geonode_provider.hooks package

Submodules

geonode_provider.hooks.geonode module

class geonode_provider.hooks.geonode.GeoNodeHook(geonode_conn_id: str, source=None)[source]

Bases: BaseHook

Airflow hook to interact with GeoNode. Methods list:

  • import_layer: runs the “importlayers” command in the GeoNode container to upload the datasets contents in a specific directory/folder to GeoServer.

  • publish_layer: publishes a layer uploaded to the database in GeoServer.

  • update_layer: runs the “updatelayers” command in the GeoNode container so that the layer already uploaded, published and recognized by GeoServer, is now visible in GeoNode.

  • upload_dataset: uploads a layer in .zip, “.shp”, “dbf”, “shx”, “prj” or “.tif” format to GeoNode via API v2.

  • upload_style: uploads a style in “.sld” format to GeoServer.

  • update_style: update an existing style.

  • update_layer_style: assigns an already uploaded style to a layer.

  • upload_map: creates a map in GeoNode via API v2 from a set of datasets.

  • upload_document: uploads a document to GeoNode via API v2.

  • upload_metadata: uploads/sets metadata for a given type of resource (for the moment title and supplementary information).

  • set_permiss: sets permissions for a given resource.

  • get_execution_information: gets information/metadata about a performed execution.

conn_name_attr = 'geonode_conn_id'
conn_type = 'geonode'
default_conn_name = 'geonode_default'
static get_connection_form_widgets() → Dict[str, Any][source]
static get_ui_field_behaviour() → Dict[source]
hook_name = 'GeoNode'
import_layer(layers_folder_path: str) → None[source]

This method allows to update datasets to GeoServer by passing datasets directory. Just works with directories, not with single files. The method uses an SSH connection to execute a Docker command within GeoNode’s container.

Parameters:

layers_folder_path – Path to datasets directory/folder.

publish_layer(layer_names) → None[source]

This method is utilized to publish a layer to GeoServer by utilizing an API ‘POST’ request.

Parameters:

layer_names – The dataset name (not title) that must be published. Is possible to pass a list of datasets names to execute this method recursively.

set_permiss(resource_id: int, permiss_data: dict)[source]

The set_permiss method is responsible for setting permissions for a specified resource. It targets the permissions API v2 endpoint and uses a ‘PATCH’ request to update the permissions based on the provided permiss_data.

Parameters:

  • resource_id – ID of the resource whose permiss want to update.

  • permiss_data – JSON/dict object with desired permission settings.

Example JSON: .. code-block:: json

{

“users”: [ { “id”: <user_id>, “permissions”: “none” }, { “id”: <user_id>, “permissions”: “view” }, { “id”: <user_id>, “permissions”: “download” }, { “id”: <user_id>, “permissions”: “edit” }, { “id”: <user_id>, “permissions”: “manage” }, { “id”: <user_id>, “permissions”: “owner” }

],

“groups”: [ { “id”: <group_id>, “permissions”: “none” }, { “id”: <group_id>, “permissions”: “none” }

],

“organizations”: [ { “id”: <organization_id>, “permissions”: “edit” }

]

}

test_connection()[source]
update_layer(layer_names: str)[source]

The update_layer method is an operator responsible for executing the update of layers. The method uses an SSH connection to execute a Docker command within GeoNode’s container.

Parameters:

layer_name – The dataset name (not title) that must be updated. Is possible to pass a list of datasets names to execute this method recursively.

Raises:

AirflowException – Raised if an error occurs during the layer update process.

update_layer_style(layer_name: str, style_name: str) → None[source]

This method is employed to update the styles of a layer by utilizing an GeoServer API ‘PUT’ request.

Parameters:

  • layer_name – The layer/dataset name (not title) which want to apply the style.

  • style_name – The style name (already uploaded) wich want to apply to the layer/dataset.

update_style(style_path: str, style_name: str = None) → None[source]

Allows to update an existing style in ‘.sld’ format.

Parameters:

  • style_path – Path to “.sld” style file.

  • style_name – Optional. Name that the style will have in GeoServer. If isn’t defined it will take the name of “.sld” file.

upload_dataset(dataset_path: str) → str[source]

This method upload a dataset by GeoNode v2 API. Datasets can be in the following formats: - .zip - .shx, .prj, .shp and .dbf - .tif

Parameters:

dataset_path – The dataset path that must be uploaded. The path can be a directory/folder or a single file.

Returns:

For vector .zip datasets, a dictionary (json) is returned with the ID of the dataset. For individual vector or rasters datasets, the run/execution ID is returned.

upload_document(document_path: str) → str[source]

This method uploads a document to GeoNode via API v2.

Parameters:

document_path – Path to document that want to be uploaded.

Returns:

This method returns the document ID that just uploaded.

upload_map(datasets_ids: list, map_title: str) → str[source]

The upload_map method is responsible for creating a map in GeoNode via API v2. You must to choice datasets with the same projection and put them into a list. First put uppers datasets and then lowers (o base) datasets.

Parameters:

  • datasets_ids – List of datasets ids that should make up the map. Sorted from the outermost/upper layer to the lower ones.

  • map_title – The title to be placed on the map.

Returns:

This method returns a map ID just created.

upload_metadata(resource_type: str, resource_id: int, resource_title: str = None, resource_supplemental_information: str = None) → None[source]

The upload_metadata method is designed to update metadata for any resource type on GeoNode by API v2 Metadata allowed:

  • Title

  • Supplemental information

Parameters:

  • resource_type –

    Type of resource wich want to be updated his metadata. Resource type allowed:

    • dataset

    • documents

    • maps

  • resource_id – ID of the resource whose metadata want to update.

  • resource_title – The title to be placed on the resource.

  • resource_supplemental_information – The supplemental information to be placed on the resource.

upload_style(style_path: str, style_name: str = None) → None[source]

Allows to upload a style in ‘.sld’ format.

Parameters:

  • style_path – Path to “.sld” style file.

  • style_name – Optional. Name that the style will have in GeoServer. If isn’t defined it will take the name of “.sld” file.
